CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 9, 1959, pg. 14 reads: "Integrated Project Opens - The second family to move into Spring Hill Gardens, the integrated 209-unit, modernistically-designed, apartment project on the North Side, was Mr. and Mrs. Paul Burton (in kitchen above) and their two children. They were preceded by the Jack V. O'Mahony family (white).  All are pleased with quarters like those shown above (right).  Mayor Thomas Gallagher, ACTION-Housing, Inc., sponsoring agency, and other dignitaries officially opened the project last Friday.  It is the first rental project built in state, and second in the nation, under Section 221 of the Federal Housing Act.  Moderate-income families can rent units from the Fidelis Realty Co., 3508 Fifth Ave., MAyflower 1-2200. - Harris Photos. Photos."
TitMainTitle: Mr. and Mrs. Paul Burton, posed in their kitchen in Spring Hill Gardens apartment, North Side
